intro: Ervatamia repeunsis, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a perennial herb with a rosette of blue-gray, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads that disperse easily. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and drought conditions. Ervatamia repeunsis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
